epd_metadata.address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia
epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)
epd_metadata.pcr_review_conducted_by: The Technical Committee of the International EPD System

product_description.product_code: NSW - Mid North Coast - ECOPact - NE502L290

product_classification.normal_class: designed for everyday applications such as residential and commercial foundations, driveways and footpaths
product_classification.special_class: typically supplied to major construction projects including high rise buildings, dams, spillways, roads, bridges, public works infrastructure

product_description.hazardous_substances: None of the products contain substances listed in the Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern for authorisation
product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight at quarry and m³ of concrete at batching plant; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, construction, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to and from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered via trucks and ships without packaging

data_quality.geographic_representativeness: Good to very good for all data sources
data_quality.temporal_representativeness: All data sources updated within 10 years as required

system_boundaries.upstream_processes: Extraction, transport and manufacturing of raw materials; generation of electricity
system_boundaries.core_processes: External transportation of materials; manufacturing of concrete (excluding mixing in truck); treatment of waste and wastewater
system_boundaries.downstream_processes: Distribution, installation, wastage, transport and treatment of waste at end of life
system_boundaries.other_environmental_information: Module D indicates environmental benefits from reuse, recovery, and recycling of deconstructed concrete

installation.operational_control: Holcim does not have operational control over installation

deconstruction.process: Physical process of drilling and removing concrete using hydraulic excavator

end_of_life.notes: End-of-life fate is outside Holcim's control; assumptions based on common scenarios and National Waste Report 2022

carbonation.description: Concrete absorbs CO2 from atmosphere over its lifetime (carbonation), partially offsetting emissions from cement manufacturing

allocation_method.fly_ash: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included
allocation_method.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Allocated economically due to significant economic value
allocation_method.silica_fume: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.background_data_allocation: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach adopted as default for secondary data and processes

additional_info.product_safety: Classified as Non-Dangerous Goods according to Australian Code for Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail
additional_info.hazard_phrases: Listed in safety data sheet for pre-mixed concrete
references: Australian Life Cycle Inventory Database Initiative Guidelines (2023)
British Standards Institution BS EN 15804:2012+A2:2019 and BS EN 16757:2017
Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water National Waste Report 2022
EPD International General Programme Instructions V£.0 (2024)
Man Yu et al., Procedia Engineering, Volume 180, 2017
disclaimers: Results are relative statements and do not indicate endpoints, thresholds, safety margins or risks
Certain impact categories have high uncertainties or limited experience
Ionizing radiation indicator excludes effects from nuclear accidents, occupational exposure, and radioactive waste disposal underground
additional_info.notes: This publication supersedes all previous literature on this subject. Specifications and details may change; users must confirm current issue with Holcim Customer Service. This publication is general information only and not a substitute for professional technical engineering advice.
